intro: Meyna comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
